result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shayne A Longley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shayne A Longley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Shayne A Longley.  Defendant's appearance waived to court congestion.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE due to court congestion. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Per Order dated October 31, 2022, Appeal No 2022XX1340-CR,
IT IS ORDERED that this court will take no action on Mr. Longley's pro se motion filed on October 27, 2022.
Motion to Dismiss Action, courtesy copy received and filed.

Defendant Shayne A Longley not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Hampton has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shayne A Longley appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Shayne A Longley in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Shayne A Longley in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shayne A Longley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 5,6,7. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
